quoteFirst: Indeed, the visitors felt that, after their struggles with the crowd outside the gate, it was almost an anticlimax to find the three so calmly facing the prospect of a flight into eternity, and, after a few moments' conversation, shook hands and prepared to depart. The clock pointed to
quoteLast: . The start was to take place precisely at eight-fifty. At the bottom, they all stopped and looked up. Bennie waved his hand to them.
title: The Moon Maker
author: Train, Arthur Cheney, 1875-1945; Wood, Robert Williams, 1868-1955; McSherry, Frank D., Jr., 1927-1997 [Illustrator]
